summary: The 'One Agency Act' aims to transfer antitrust enforcement responsibilities from the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) to the Department of Justice (DOJ). It defines terms like 'antitrust laws', 'effective date', and 'FTC antitrust unit'. The bill mandates the transfer of FTC antitrust actions, employees, assets, and funding to the DOJ, over a transition period. It details how the DOJ will handle ongoing cases, consent decrees, and investigative studies.  The bill also makes numerous technical and conforming amendments to various Acts to reflect the shift in authority, and sets an effective date tied to the fiscal year following enactment.
